text: Congratulations to team member Shiqi Lou for his incoming PhD journey under the supervision of Prof. Sibo Wang at The Chinese University of Hong Kong!

Congratulations to director Heng Wang, Yuyang Bai for their incoming PhD journey!</br>
Heng Wang is joining Prof. Heng ji and Prof. Jiawei Han @ UIUC.</br>
Yuyang Bai is joining Prof. Yu Zhang's lab @ Texas A&M University.

Congratulations to team members Ruijie He, Yuyang Tian, Zifeng Zhu, Sicheng Yang, Zinan Zeng for their incoming PhD & MS/MPhil journey!</br>
Ruijie He is joining Prof. Yuan Feng's lab @ THU.</br>
Yuyang Tian is joining Prof. Xuelong Li's lab @ USTC & Shanghai ailab.</br>
Zifeng Zhu is joining Prof. Qinghua Zheng's lab @ XJTU.</br>
Sicheng Yang is joining Prof. Lei Zhu's lab @ HKUST.</br>
Zinan Zeng is joining Prof. Ning Ding's lab @ XJTU.
Congratulations to former director Yuhan Liu for her incoming PhD journey under the supervision of Prof. Eunsol Choi at New York University!
Our paper, MMoE: Robust Spoiler Detection with Multi-modal Information and Domain-aware Mixture-of-Experts goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, LMBot: Distilling Graph Knowledge into Language Model for Graph-less Deployment in Twitter Bot Detection, has been accepted at WSDM 2023.
Our paper, Detecting Spoilers in Movie Reviews with External Movie Knowledge and User Networks, has been accepted at EMNLP 2023.

Congratulations to team members Sen Ye, Zijian Cai for their incoming PhD & MS journey!</br>
Sen Ye is joining Prof. Liwei Wang's lab @ PKU.</br>
Zijian Cai is joining Prof. Chunfeng Yuan's lab @ CASIA.
Congratulations to Heng Wang, former director Shangbin Feng and former director Zhaoxuan Tan for their NeurIPS 2023 spotlight, Can Language Models Solve Graph Problems in Natural Language?.

Congratulations to former director Shangbin Feng and director Yuhan Liu for their ACL2023 best paper award, From Pretraining Data to LMs to Downstream Tasks: Tracking the Trails of Political Biases Leading to Unfair NLP Models!
Our paper, LMBot: Distilling Graph Knowledge into Language Model for Graph-less Deployment in Twitter Bot Detection goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, HOFA: Twitter Bot Detection with Homophily-Oriented Augmentation and Frequency Adaptive Attention goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, AHEAD: A Triple Attention Based Heterogeneous Graph Anomaly Detection Approach , has been accepted at CIAC-2023.
Our paper, BIC: Twitter Bot Detection with Text-Graph Interaction and Semantic Consistency, has been accepted at ACL 2023.
Our paper, BotMoE: Twitter Bot Detection with Community-Aware Mixtures of Modal-Specific Experts, has been accepted at SIGIR 2023.
Our paper, KRACL: Contrastive Learning with Graph Context Modeling for Sparse Knowledge Graph Completion, has been accepted at WWW 2023.
Our paper, PAR: Political Actor Representation Learning with Social Context and Expert Knowledge, has been accepted at EMNLP 2022.

Congratulations to team members Qingyue Zhang, Yanbo Wang for their incoming PhD journey!</br>
Qingyue Zhang is joining Prof. Shao-Lun Huang's lab @ Tsinghua SIGS.</br>
Yanbo Wang is joining Prof. Muhan Zhang's lab @ PKU.
Our paper, TwiBot-22: Towards Graph-Based Twitter Bot Detection, has been accepted at NeurIPS, Dataset and Benchmark Track, 2022.
Our paper, AHEAD: A Triple Attention Based Heterogeneous Graph Anomaly Detection Approach goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, BIC: Twitter Bot Detection with Text-Graph Interaction and Semantic Consistency goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, KRACL: Contrastive Learning with Graph Context Modeling for Sparse Knowledge Graph Completion goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, GraTO: Graph Neural Network Framework Tackling Over-smoothing with Neural Architecture Search, has been accepted at CIKM 2022.
Our paper, TwiBot-22: Towards Graph-Based Twitter Bot Detection goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, KCD: Knowledge Walks and Textual Cues Enhanced Political Perspective Detection in News Media, has been accepted at NAACL 2022.
Congratulations to director Shangbin Feng for his incoming PhD journey under the supervision of Prof. Yulia Tsvetkov at the University of Washington!
Congratulations to team member Binchi Zhang for his incoming PhD journey under the supervision of Prof. Jundong Li at the University of Virginia!
Knowledge Graph Augmented Political Perspective Detection in News Media is significantly updated and available.

Legislator Representation Learning with Social Context and Expert Knowledge, formerly Encoding Heterogeneous Social and Political Context for Entity Stance Prediction, is significantly updated and availble.
Our paper, Heterogeneity-aware Twitter Bot Detection with Relational Graph Transformers, has been accepted at AAAI 2022.
Our paper, PPSGCN: A Privacy-Preserving Subgraph Sampling Based Distributed GCN Training Method, goes live on Arxiv.

Congratulations to team members Herun Wan, Ningnan Wang, Zilong Chen, Qingyao Li, Peisheng Yu for their incoming PhD candidacy!</br>
Herun Wan is joining Prof. Minnan Luo's lab @ XJTU.</br>
Ningnan Wang is joining Prof. Hongbin Sun's lab @ XJTU.</br>
Zilong Chen is joining Prof. Huaping Liu's lab @ THU.</br>
Qingyao Li is joining Prof. Yong Yu's lab @ SJTU.</br>
Peisheng Yu is joining Prof. Man-cho-so's lab @ CUHK.
Our paper, BotRGCN: Twitter Bot Detection with Relational Graph Convolutional Networks, has been accepted at ASONAM 2021.
Our paper, Heterogeneity-aware Twitter Bot Detection with Relational Graph Transformers, goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, SATAR: A Self-supervised Approach to Twitter Account Representation Learning and its Application in Bot Detection, has been accepted at CIKM 2021.
Our paper, TwiBot-20: A Comprehensive Twitter Bot Detection Benchmark, has been accepted at CIKM 2021.
Our paper, Knowledge Graph Augmented Political Perspective Detection in News Media, goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, Encoding Heterogeneous Social and Political Context for Entity Stance Prediction, goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, BotRGCN: Twitter Bot Detection with Relational Graph Convolutional Networks, goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, TwiBot-20: A Comprehensive Twitter Bot Detection Benchmark, goes live on Arxiv.
Our paper, SATAR: A Self-supervised Approach to Twitter Account Representation Learning and its Application in Bot Detection, goes live on Arxiv.
